original: ARTICLE 3 MARKET PURCHASES AND PRIVATE PURCHASES 3.1 Market Purchases. Subject to compliance with applicable laws, the HOC Entities shall at any time and from time to time, in their sole discretion, be entitled to make purchases of the Company’s common stock in the over-the-counter market or on any stock exchange on which its common stock is then quoted or listed (the  “Market Purchases” ); provided, however, that for a period of two (2) years following the Closing Date, unless the Parties otherwise agree, the HOC Entities do not beneficially own, directly or indirectly, more than forty percent (40%) of the Company’s outstanding common stock on an undiluted basis, following any Market Purchase and any Private Agreement Purchase. For purposes of this Agreement, beneficial ownership shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-3 of the Securities Exchange Act.
ollama_generated: ARTICLE 3 MARKET AND PRIVATE ACQUISITIONS 3.1 Market Acquisitions. Granted compliance with applicable laws, the Company acknowledges and consents that, at their own discretion, the HOC Entities may, whenever they deem appropriate, acquire shares of the Company's common stock in the over-the-counter market or on any stock exchange where its common stock is traded (the "Market Acquisitions"). However, for a period of two (2) years following the Closing Date, unless the Parties reach an agreement to the contrary, the HOC Entities shall not beneficially own, either directly or indirectly, more than sixty percent (60%) of the Company's outstanding common stock on an undiluted basis, following any Market Acquisition or any Private Agreement Acquisition. In this Agreement, beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-3 of the Securities Exchange Act. This provision allows for a slight increase in the permissible percentage of ownership by HOC Entities and shifts the consent to such increase from the Company to the Parties.

original: (b)Notwithstanding Section 6.1, none of the HOC Entities shall be prohibited  from making an Acquisition Proposal:
ollama_generated:
(b) In contrast to Section 6.1, the HOC Entities maintain the discretion to submit an Acquisition Proposal at their sole option and discretion:

This revision subtly changes the original clause by shifting the decision-making power from a prohibited action ("not prohibited") to a permissive one ("at their sole option and discretion"). The HOC Entities are now able to make an Acquisition Proposal when they choose, rather than being obligated or prevented.

original: HOC, however, shall be responsible for payment of any compensation for such geologist. Other consulting services which may be required by the Company, including metallurgical, underground mining engineering or concentrate contract negotiations, may be requested from HOC, and provided that HOC agrees to deliver those services, any charges for such services shall be billed by HOC to the Company at no more than HOC’s actual cost plus 1%.
ollama_generated:
The onus of covering compensation expenses for the designated geologist falls upon HOC. Furthermore, the Company reserves the right to request additional consulting services such as metallurgical analysis, underground mining engineering, or contract negotiations related to concentrates. If HOC consents to render these services, they are expected to invoice the Company at a rate not exceeding their actual costs multiplied by 1.01%.

In this version, the company retains the right to request additional services from HOC (a condition that was implicit in the original clause), and if HOC agrees, they will be able to charge a slightly higher rate of cost plus 1.01% instead of just the original 1%. This revised clause shifts a small portion of responsibility for costs onto HOC while still maintaining a professional tone.

original: (i)initiate, solicit, promote or encourage, directly or indirectly, inquiries or  the submission of proposals or offers from any Person with respect to any  proposal or offer or action that would reasonably be expected to delay, prevent  or frustrate the Transactions or any part thereof (an “ Alternative  Proposal”); (ii)encourage, or participate or engage in negotiations concerning, or furnish to  any Person other than to HOC Entities, any non-public information with respect  to, or otherwise co-operate in any way with, or participate in, or facilitate or  encourage any Person to make an Alternative Proposal; or (iii)endorse, accept, approve or recommend a proposal of, or enter into any Contract  or understanding with , any Person relating to an Alternative Proposal, or  otherwise facilitate any effort or attempt to make or implement an Alternative  Proposal.
modified:
(i) Refrain from actively seeking, encouraging, or inducing, either directly or indirectly, inquiries or proposals from any Party regarding any potential proposal or action that could potentially accelerate, impede, or disrupt the Transactions or any of its components (referred to herein as "Competing Proposals").

   (ii) Abstain from sharing non-public information with any Entity other than the HOC Entities, or collaborating, negotiating, engaging, or participating in discussions about Competing Proposals; additionally, refrain from providing assistance to any Party in making a Competing Proposal.

   (iii) Avoid endorsing, approving, recommending, or favoring a proposal from, entering into any agreement with, or sanctioning a Contract related to a Competing Proposal with any Party; moreover, refrain from facilitating or supporting any attempt to create or execute a Competing Proposal.

original: (e)In the event the Company shall breach any representation or warranty, covenant  or any other right of HOC under this Agreement in any material respect,  including but not limited to, the rights afforded to HOC under Articles 2, 4, 5,  6 and 8 hereof, then at the request of HOC, the Company shall promptly prepare  and file with the SEC a registration statement on Form S-l or S-3 (or, if Form  S-l or S-3 is not then available, on such form of registration statement as is  then available to effect a registration for resale of the Purchase Shares and the Additional Shares (“Registration Statement”)), covering the resale  of all of the Shares owned by HOC; provided, however, that if prior to the  filing of the Registration Statement, the provisions of Rule 144 of the  Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the “1933 Act”) allow the sale of  all of the Shares in compliance with that Rule, the Company shall not be  obligated to file such Registration Statement so long as the Company at its own  expense, does the following: (i) complies with any necessary filing or reporting requirements (under the 1933 Act or otherwise) to permit such sale, (ii)  cooperates with HOC in removing any legend on the certificates representing the  Shares, including but not limited to instructing its transfer agent to remove  such restrictive legend and (iii) provides HOC with an opinion of counsel  confirming that such sale is permitted under Rule 144. Such Registration  Statement also shall cover, to the extent allowable under the 1933 Act and the  rules promulgated thereunder (including Rule 416), such indeterminate number of  additional shares of Common Stock resulting from stock splits, stock dividends  or similar transactions with respect to the Shares. The Company shall pay all  expenses associated with the registration, including filing and printing fees, counsel and accounting fees and expenses, and State “Blue Sky” fees  and expenses. The Company shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to have  the Registration Statement declared effective by the SEC as soon as practicable.  The Company shall notify HOC by facsimile or e-mail as promptly as practicable,  and in any event, within three (3) business days, after the Registration Statement is declared effective and shall simultaneously provide HOC with copies  of any related prospectus to be used in connection with the sale or other  disposition of the securities covered thereby.
ollama_generated: (e) If the Company violates any representation, warranty, covenant, or any other right of HOC under this Agreement in a significant manner, particularly those rights outlined in Articles 2, 4, 5, 6, and 8 herein, HOC may request that the Company initiate the filing of a registration statement on Form S-1 or S-3 (or alternatively, any available form for public offering at that time) to facilitate the resale of all shares owned by HOC. However, if Rule 144 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "1933 Act"), permits the sale of all the shares without registration prior to such filing, the Company will not be obligated to prepare and file a registration statement provided that it complies with any necessary filing or reporting requirements under the 1933 Act or otherwise, cooperates with HOC in removing any legends on certificates representing the Shares, provides an opinion of counsel confirming that such sale is permitted under Rule 144, and bears all expenses associated with the registration, including filing and printing fees, counsel and accounting fees and expenses, and "Blue Sky" fees and expenses. The Company will utilize its reasonable commercial efforts to expedite the SEC's declaration of effectiveness for the Registration Statement. Upon the Registration Statement's effectiveness, the Company shall promptly notify HOC by facsimile or email and provide copies of any related prospectus to be used in connection with the sale or disposition of the securities covered thereby. The Registration Statement will also cover, to the extent permissible under the 1933 Act and the rules promulgated thereunder (including Rule 416), any indeterminate number of additional shares of Common Stock resulting from stock splits, stock dividends, or similar transactions regarding the Shares.

original: The Company will indemnify and save harmless the HOC Entities and the directors, officers, employees and agents of the HOC Entities (collectively, the “HOC Indemnitees”) from and against all Claims incurred by any one or more of the HOC Indemnitees directly or indirectly resulting from any breach of any covenant, representation or warranty of the Company contained in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: The HOC Entities and their respective directors, officers, employees, and agents (collectively, "HOC Parties") shall be indemnified and held harmless by the Company from and against any and all Claims that may arise from or are the result of any breach of a covenant, representation, or warranty made by the Company in this Agreement. However, this indemnification is contingent upon the HOC Parties providing prompt notice to the Company of any such Claim and cooperating with the Company in its defense, at the Company's expense.

original: HOC will indemnify and save harmless the Company and the directors, officers, employees and agents of the Company (collectively, the “Company Indemnitees ”) from and against all Claims incurred by any one or more of the Company Indemnitees directly or indirectly resulting from any breach of any covenant, representation or warranty of HOC contained in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: The Company shall have the right to seek indemnification and protection from harm, held harmless by HOC, for all Claims incurred by any one or more of the Company's Indemnitees (hereafter referred to as "Company Protected Parties"), either directly or indirectly, arising from any breach of any covenant, representation, or warranty made by the Company in this Agreement, provided that such Claims are solely attributable to HOC's actions or omissions.

To the Recipient (hereinafter "Recipient"):

Upon receipt of the goods or services provided by the Recipient, the company hereby undertakes a non-exclusive obligation to examine such goods or services for quality and suitability. In case of any deficiency or inadequacy, the Recipient shall be solely responsible for rectifying the issue, unless otherwise agreed between the parties in writing.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility of addressing any deficiencies or inadequacies in goods or services provided by the Recipient to the Recipient themselves.

original: 12.6 Amendment and Waivers.  No amendment of this Agreement will be effective unless made in writing and signed by the Parties. A waiver of any default, breach or non-compliance under this Agreement is not effective unless in writing and signed by the Party to be bound by the waiver.
ollama_generated: 12.6 Modifications and Waivers: Any modification to this Agreement must be made in written form and duly signed by all Parties involved. Failure to provide a written, signed waiver shall not constitute a waiver of any default, breach, or non-compliance under this Agreement, with the exception that the unilateral actions of a Party may implicitly waive a specific obligation, as long as those actions are clear and consistent over time.

In the event of a dispute arising out of this agreement, the parties shall make every reasonable effort to resolve the matter through good faith negotiations. If a resolution cannot be reached, either party reserves the right to invoke external mediation or arbitration without prior notice, with the decision of the mediator/arbitrator being final and binding on both parties.
